alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 6:12AM CDT until August 04 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHERN GIBSON AND SOUTHWESTERN WEAKLEY COUNTIES... At 612 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dyer, Greenfield, Kenton, Rutherford, Bradford, Sharon, Good Luck, Barrons Corner, Kimery, Laneview, Georgetown, Grizzard, Skullbone, Currie, Tyson Store, Tilghman, Staffords Store, Holly Leaf and Big Cypress Tree State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
